title: Lease for one year of property in the West Indies, including enslaved persons, from Hungerford Spooner and Sir Cecil Wray to Thomas Norton. Consideration money and an annual rent of one peppercorn. References the islands of Saint Christopher (St. Kitts), Jamaica, Grenada. Signed and sealed by Spooner and Wray. George III

title: West Indies, Island of St. Vincent. 3 skins of parchment, being a schedule of enslaved persons in an indenture, being a marriage settlement between Sir William Young, and his intended second wife Barbara Talbot. George, Marquis of Buckingham and Jacob, Earl of Radnor are named as trustees for the settlement, with Duncan Campbell and James Hartley appointed as attorneys. The list of 227 enslaved persons is subdivided by gender and age. ref: George III

title: 5 skins, incomplete. Indenture regarding the ownership through various trusts of a plantation in the West Indies, including enslaved persons, tenements, messages, plantation utensils, storehouses, cattle, horses, etc. References the islands of Saint Christopher (St. Kitts) and Grenada. A payment of 60,000 pounds was made at some time. Interested parties include: Sir Cecil Wray, William Manning, Samuel Bosanquet. Previous indentures quoted

title: Document of parchment, 5 skins, incomplete, first and last sheets missing. The indenture deals with the ownership of plantations, enslaved persons, and similar West Indies properties. Family name is Duport. Assignment Mrs. Harris to John Spooner; her maiden name may have been Duport. References island of St. Christopher (St. Kitts). George II
